info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:16PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact eastern portions of the Flagstaff Metro Area of Coconino County through 300 PM MST... At 215 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Flagstaff Mall, or near Flagstaff, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Flagstaff Mall, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument, Timberline, Hutchison Acres, Cosnino, Winona, Bonito Campground At Sunset Crater, Doney Park, Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Sunset Crater Visitors Center, Walnut Canyon Visitors Center and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. This includes the following highways... Route 66 between mile markers 198 and 204. Interstate 40 between mile markers 198 and 211. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 419 and 430. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
